description: Clipping of talking picture, via  +â€Ž -ie, and thus morphologically parallel with movie.

entries.meaning: (informal, dated or historical) A movie with sound, as opposed to a silent film.
examples: On October 6, 1927, Warner Bros. released The Jazz Singer, the first sound-synched feature film, prompting a technological shift of unprecedented speed and unstoppable force. Within two years, nearly every studio release was a talkie.
